message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CY 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with sentiment classification across different languages and proposes a novel representation learning method using emojis. It could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it involves learning representations for sentiment classification. Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it involves the use of machine learning techniques for sentiment classification. It could also be classified under cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as sentiment classification is often used in information retrieval tasks. Finally, it could be categorized under cs.CY (Computers and Society) as it deals with the issue of language inequality in information services received by users speaking different languages.
